meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, the sun began to reemerge from behind the clouds.
meanings.sent2: The flowers will reemerge in the spring after the winter frost melts away.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the coin reemerge from behind the volunteer's ear.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to reemerge after she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The memories of his childhood reemerged vividly as he walked through the old neighborhood.

meanings.definition: To come into view or notice again
meanings.sent1: As the fog lifted, the lighthouse reemerged, guiding the ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: The missing cat finally reemerged from its hiding spot under the bed.
meanings.sent3: The long-lost book reemerged on the shelf, surprising the librarian.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for painting reemerged after years of not picking up a brush.
meanings.sent5: The stars reemerged in the night sky as the clouds drifted away.
